title: GPs can now diagnose and treat ADHD in Vic | ABC NEWS
description: GPs in Victoria will soon be able to diagnose and treat ADHD, being one of the last states to do so.   Reporting by Amal Wehbe, ABC News Social Media team. title: Time for government action to combat inflation and productivity, says PC boss | The Business
description: The Reserve Bank's decision to hike the interest rate on the back of a poorer economic outlook has placed a spotlight on inflation and Australia's productivity problem. The RBA Governor Michele Bullock cited the chair of the Productivity Commission as someone with lots of good ideas to increase productivity - and presumably supply capacity as well. Chair Danielle Wood joined The Business to explain some of those ideas to boost productivity in Australia. She says productivity reforms require work on a lot of different fronts. "We would like to see them (the government) be ambitious ... We have put a whole range of different options on the table and I think really this is the time where we want to see government taking the mantle when it comes to productivity reform." She said.  #ABCBusiness Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Mum wrangles crocodile lurking in puddle outside NT bottle shop | ABC NEWS
description: There's been a surprise visitor at a Northern Territory pub, with a crocodile wandering up to the unorthodox watering hole.  Regulars got a fright when they dropped in for a cold one, with the croc lingering in water from heavy rains out the front.  Some helpful locals from Humpty Doo on Darwin's outskirts, helped remove the unwanted visitor.  Crocodiles are highly mobile this time of year as waterways fill up allowing them to travel vast distances. title: Australian Defence Force looks to sell sites across the Northern Territory | ABC NEWS
description: Nearly 500 hectares of land owned by the Defence Force in the Northern Territory is to be put up for sale by the ADF, following a national audit of the defence estate.  World War 2-era installations in Darwin's CBD and Berrimah are among the Territory sites earmarked for sale, with Defence hoping to recoup 1.8 Billion dollars from divestment in 68 sites across the country.   Oliver Chaseling has this report for ABC News Northern Territory.   Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. description: Organisers of Sydney's Mardi Gras have defended the last-minute cancellation of its official party event, insisting it was essential to the festival's survival. title: Wheelchair basketball champs dropped from national competition due to financial risk | ABC NEWS
description: Australia's wheelchair basketball champions, the Darwin Salties, say they've been blindsided by the team's sudden axing from this year's national season.  The news follows the Darwin Basketball Association going into administration and Basketball NT deciding it could not take on the financial risk. Felicity James has this report for ABC News Northern Territory.   ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: NT lawn bowls team heads to Malaysia to support Australian Jackaroos | ABC NEWS
description: Lawn bowlers from across the Northern Territory are heading to Malaysia, to support the Australian Jackaroos as they trial for the Commonwealth Games.  The experience will allow the NT team to learn from the best, and even get the chance to face off with the Malaysian National team.  Reporter Shane Schafer caught up with the Territory team on the green before they head overseas.   ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Thailand election: Young gun Natthaphong Ruengpanyawut leads race to be PM | The World | ABC News
description: Millions of voters in Thailand will cast their ballots in a hotly contested general election on February 8th. Right now, it appears to be a three way contest, that includes the incumbent Bumjaithai, People's Party and, the party of the Shinawatra clan, Pheu Thai. The World's Girish Sawlani talks to Professor Thitinan Pongsudhirak from Chulalongkon University about the frontrunners in the poll and who will likely form the next government. #ABCTheWorld #ABCAsiaPacific Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Explosive claims emerge of Bill Gates' ties to Jeffrey Epstein | The World | ABC NEWS
description: Billionaire Bill Gates has rejected allegations in the latest release of Epstein files as "absolutely absurd and completely false". The latest documents indicate Mr Gates met with the late convicted sex offender on multiple occasions after Jeffrey Epstein's prison sentence.  In one email sent to himself in 2013, Epstein appears to suggest that Mr Gates contracted a sexually transmitted disease and sought to secretly give his then-wife, Melinda French Gates, antibiotics. Harry Melkonian from the US Studies Centre spoke to The World's Girish Sawlani about the possible consequences from the latest release of the Epstein files.
